original: Berger, Svante Edwin, direktör, Halmstad, f. 13/5/71 i Vänersborgs landsförs. G. 02 m. Anna Kindal. Barn: Kurt f. 04, Gunvald 07, Anita 08, Carl Magnus 15. — Anst. v. Troll-hätte kanals huv:kont. 89, kanahnsp. 97-02, verkst. dir. o. ordf. i styr. f. A-B Malcus Holmquist i Halmstad sed. 02, i Halmstads Verkstads A-B sed. 07, i Nissaströms A-B sed. 17 o. i Lagamills A-B 21-31. Styr:led. i Gbgs Bank i Halmstad sed. 17, ordf. 41-43, led. av direkt, f. länslas. i Halmstad 06-41 o. Spenshults sanat. sed. 23, led. av stadsfullm. 06-27, av kyrkoråd sed. 19, led. av kyrkofullm., led. av Skånes hand:kamm. fullm. o. arb :utsk. 13-46, styr :led. i Sydsv. geo-gr. sällsk. i Lund, hed :led. i Hall. nat. i Lund sed. 32. Igångsatt o. bekost. und:sökn. av ortnamn i Hall. 1. o. VSL arkeolog. und:sökn:ar i Hall. KV02kl, RNO, KFinlLO, Korresp-LHA, LGAA, dess GM, LVSL.
translated: Berger, Svante Edwin, director, Halmstad, b. May 13, 1871 in Vänersborg rural district. Married in 1902 to Anna Kindal. Children: Kurt b. 1904, Gunvald b. 1907, Anita b. 1908, Carl Magnus b. 1915. Employed by the Trollhätte Canal head office in 1889, canal inspector from 1897-1902, managing director and chairman of the board for Malcus Holmquist AB in Halmstad since 1902, and for Halmstads Verkstads AB since 1907, for Nissaströms AB since 1917, and Lagamills AB from 1921-1931. Board member of GBG's Bank in Halmstad since 1917, chairman from 1941-1943, member of the County Administrative Board for Halland County from 1906-1941, member of the Spenshult sanatorium since 1923, member of the city council from 1906-1927, member of the church council since 1919, member of the church assembly, member of Skånes Handelskammare's assembly and labor committee from 1913-1946, board member of the South Swedish Geographical Society in Lund, honorary member of the Halland National Society in Lund since 1932. Initiated and financed research on place names in Halland, and archeological research in Halland. Member of the Royal Society of Humanities.Learned correspondence with the Halland Collectors Association, Gothenburg Antiquarian Society, and the Royal Society of Science in Lund.
